questions.question: Choose the correct sentence:
options: a) How long are you joined this company?
b) When have you joined this company?
c) How long have you joined this company?
d) When you do join this company?
questions.answer: B (Most likely intended answer for "When did you join", though "did" is grammatically superior to "have" with 'when')

questions.question: Choose the correct sentence:
options: a) After the picnic, we had lots of food left.
b) After the picnic, we had lot of food left.
c) After the picnic, we had lots of foods left.
d) After the picnic, we had lot of foods left.

questions.question: Choose the correct sentence:
options: a) I do my works quick
b) I did my work quickly
c) I does my work very quick
d) I did my work quick

questions.question: Choose the correct sentence:
options: a) The shadow follows the child everywhere.
b) The shadows follows the child everywhere.
c) The shadows follows the childs everywhere.
d) The shadow following the child everywhere.

questions.question: Choose the correct sentence:
options: a) She is both a dancer or a painter.
b) She is both a dancer nor a painter.
c) She is both a dancer as well as a painter.
d) She is both a dancer and a painter.

questions.question: Everyone considered him as a brave man but he fled from the battlefield.
options: c) But he fled from the battlefield

questions.question: During the rainy season many rivers overflew their banks and caused great difficulty.
options: b) Many rivers overflew their banks

questions.question: He was borne of poor parents but brought up in an affluent family.
options: a) He was borne of poor parents

questions.question: It is a known fact that time does not return back once it is lost.
options: a) It is a known fact
b) That time does not return back

questions.question: The Prime Minister called on the President yesterday.
I has been completely blind to her faults.
To give dust in one's eyes.
He earns his bread with the sweat of his brow.
They have had a real good time
Apart from writing the letter for me, he posted it.
I saw a dead ox walking there.
options: a) I have seen a dead ox walking there.
b) while walking there I saw a dead ox.
c) there is a dead ox walking seen by me.

questions.question: His bonafides are in doubt.
questions.answer: B (or D depending on strict plurality, but 'is' is commonly accepted for the concept of sincerity)

questions.question: Usage of BOARD (Select inappropriate usage)
options: a) passengers should board the train now.
b) Vishal is elected to the Board of Directors of Lion's Club.
c) what do they charge for room and boarding?
d) dinner will be served on board the plane.

questions.question: Usage of EFFECT (Select inappropriate usage)
options: a) impatient investors effected our roll out date
b) the management effected a sweeping policy change
c) the hot sun always has a burning effect on my skin
d) the production relied too much on spectacular effects

questions.question: Usage of ADVICE (Select inappropriate usage)
options: a) the mother adviced his son to stay away from bad company
b) If you are unsure, get advice from a solicitor
c) the committee said that they feel like an advice bureau
d) he was too proud to ever seek advice

questions.question: Usage of CROP (Select inappropriate usage)
options: a) the main crops are rice and wheat
b) the drought destroyed the crops in Rajasthan
c) the dress had to be cropped to fit her
d) we had a bumper crop this year
questions.answer: C (Dress is usually hemmed/altered, though cropped is possible, it is the least standard)

questions.question: Usage of ENSURE (Select inappropriate usage)
options: a) please ensure that she reaches here in time.
b) all her ornaments are heavily ensured against theft.
c) the college ensures fairness in the application process.
d) ensuring that no one was watching, she opened the letter.

questions.question: Error Detection: No sooner (a) / had he said it when he realised (b)/his folly (c) / no error (d).
options: b) had he said it when he realised

questions.question: Error Detection: Yesterday Mark got the (a) / information that his father (b) / died of accident (c) / no error (d).
questions.answer: C (Should be 'died in an accident' or 'died of injuries from an accident')

questions.question: Error Detection: Though he was (a) / highly educated (b) / but he was very modest (c) / no error (d).
options: c) but he was very modest

questions.question: Error Detection: A man jumped (a) / in the river (b) / in a state of depression (c) / no error (d).
options: c) in a state of depression

questions.question: Error Detection: He came (a) / from abroad (b) / for seeing me (c) / no error (d).
Error Detection: It was so lovely weather (a) / that we spent (b) / the whole day in the garden (c) / no error (d).
options: a) It was so lovely weather
c) the whole day in the garden
questions.answer: A (Should be 'It was such lovely weather' or 'It was so lovely a day')

questions.question: Error Detection: Jack was living in Dover (a) / for five years (b) / before the year 2020 (c) / no error (d).
options: a) Jack was living in Dover
questions.answer: A (Should be 'Jack had been living' - Past Perfect Continuous)

questions.question: Error Detection: Us (a) / may stay (b) / in Darjeeling until the monsoon starts (c) / no error (d).
options: c) in Darjeeling until the monsoon starts

questions.question: Error Detection: The road (a) / to famous movement (b) / passes through a forest (c) / no error (d).
questions.answer: B (Missing an article: 'to the famous monument')

questions.question: Error Detection: He can (a) / only be cured (b) / by a surgical procedure (c) / no error (d).
Error Detection: The girl who you wanted (a) / to marry is a teacher (b)/in a convent school (c)/ No error (d).
options: a) The girl who you wanted
b) to marry is a teacher
questions.answer: A (Should be 'whom' as it is the object of 'wanted')

questions.question: Error Detection: She had her bath, (a) / ate her breakfast (b)/and after all went to school (c)/No error (d).
options: c) and after all went to school

questions.question: Error Detection: The ship's crew has (a) / tried to save the passengers (b)/from drowning in water (c) / No error (d).
options: b) tried to save the passengers
questions.answer: A (If crew refers to individual members, use 'have'; given the attempt to save, plurality is implied: 'have')

questions.question: Error Detection: This matter should be (a)/ discussed strictly between (b)/ you and I (c) / No error (d).
questions.answer: C (Should be 'you and me' as it follows the preposition 'between')

questions.question: Error Detection: The audience of a football match (a) / are pleased (b) / when a goal is scored (c) / No error (d).
options: a) The audience of a football match
c) when a goal is scored
questions.answer: B (Audience is usually treated as a collective noun here, use 'is pleased')

questions.question: Select the correct sentence:
options: a) After the picnic, we had lots of bread left.
b) After the picnic we had lot of breads left.
c) After the picnic we had lot of bread left.
d) After the picnic, we had lots of breads left.

questions.question: Select the correct sentence:
options: a) I did my work quick.
b) I did my work very quick.
c) I did my work quickly.

questions.question: Select the correct sentence:
options: a) I am ready to say this at her face.
b) I am ready to say this on her face.
c) I am ready to say this in her face.
d) I am ready to say this to her face.

questions.question: Select the correct sentence:
options: a) The villagers were enjoying winter evening around the fire.
b) The villagers were enjoying winter evening around fire.
c) The villagers were enjoying winter evening round fire.
d) The villagers were enjoying winter evening all round fire.

questions.question: Select the correct sentence:
options: a) The team is confident to win the match.
b) The team is confident of winning the match.
c) The team is confident to win match.
d) The team is confident for winning the match.

questions.question: Best way of writing the sentence:
options: a) There is little traffic on the roads.
b) There is a little traffic on the roads.
c) There is small traffic on the roads.
d) There is least traffic on the roads.

questions.question: Best way of writing the sentence:
options: a) Excess knowledge is a dangerous thing
b) Excessive knowledge is a dangerous thing
c) A little knowledge is a dangerous thing
d) A less knowledge is a dangerous thing

questions.question: Best way of writing the sentence:
options: a) His house consists three bedrooms and a toilet
b) His house comprises of three bedrooms and a toilet
c) His house comprises three bedrooms and a toilet
d) His house consists with three bedrooms and a toilet
questions.answer: C (Option A is also acceptable if 'of' follows 'consists', but C uses 'comprises' correctly without 'of')

questions.question: Best way of writing the sentence:
options: a) There is a part of him that does not want to join the fold
b) Partly he does not want to join the fold
c) A part of him does not want to join the fold
d) The part of him does not want to join the fold

questions.question: Best way of writing the sentence:
options: a) She has a little followers
b) She has got few followers

questions.question: Sentence Improvement: This is not a good way to write the sentence.
Sentence Improvement: The Police tracked down on the drug dealers' racket.
Sentence Improvement: No sooner the teacher entered than the students kept quiet.
options: c) As soon as teacher entered
questions.answer: D (A better, corrected sentence would use inversion: "No sooner did the teacher enter than...")

questions.question: Sentence Improvement: The alarm sounded and the workers left.
options: a) The workers left as the alarm sounded.
b) The workers heard the alarm and left.
c) When the alarm sounded, the workers left.

questions.question: Sentence Improvement: We are getting the subsidised rate.
Sentence Improvement: I shall know her as soon as I see her.
Sentence Improvement: He told to us everything he knew.
options: b) Us everything he is knowing
c) Us everything he was knowing

questions.question: Error Detection: He was a leader and an able Statesman.
Error Detection: They are paid a heavy price for their mistakes.
questions.answer: B (Should be 'heavy price' is fine, but in context of money paid, 'high price' is more idiomatic)

questions.question: Error Detection: You can clean it by soap.
Error Detection: We accidentally met at on the coffee shop
Error Detection: Human minds (a) / is slow to adjust (b)/ to changing conditions (c)/No error (d).
questions.answer: A (Subject-verb agreement: 'Human mind' (singular) or change 'is' to 'are')

questions.question: Error Detection: Western scientific inventions (a)/has increased use of sophisticated equipment (b)/ and transformed our lives at an astounding speed (c) / No error (d).
options: b) has increased use of sophisticated equipment
c) and transformed our lives at an astounding speed
questions.answer: B (Should be 'have increased' since the subject is plural: 'inventions')

questions.question: Error Detection: Knowledge can be achieved through education (a)/but since it is the power of mind (b) / it cannot be achieved through all (c) / No error (d).
options: a) Knowledge can be achieved through education
b) but since it is the power of mind
c) it cannot be achieved through all

questions.question: Error Detection: No human being (a) / howsoever great or powerful (b)/ was ever so free than a fish (c)/No error (d).
options: c) was ever so free than a fish
questions.answer: C (Should be 'as' instead of 'than': 'so free as a fish')

questions.question: Error Detection: She has a remarkably kind disposition (a) / who wins her friends (b) / wherever she goes (c)/No error (d).
options: a) She has a remarkably kind disposition
questions.answer: B (Disposition is a quality, not a person, so use 'which' or 'that')

questions.question: Error Detection: After the summer break, school will open after two weeks.
questions.answer: B (Reopen is most appropriate for school after a break)

questions.question: Error Detection: The stream flowed gently under the bridge.
Error Detection: The train from Chennai arrived right in schedule.
Error Detection: The speeding driver is finally caught over the police.
Error Detection: The children enjoyed rowing the boat on the lake.
Error Detection: The boy trembled in fear of the deadly snake.
Error Detection: The film "Titanic" is one of the greatest movies ever made.
Error Detection: He has the guts to rise from the occasion.
Error Detection: He said, every man should look up the future.
Grammar Alternative: ____ have been to the football match.
options: d) Neither me nor Andy gives
questions.answer: A (Verb agrees with the closest subject, 'I', which is correct for 'have been'; I before Andy is convention but not grammatical rule)

questions.question: Grammar Alternative: ____, there are so many things to talk about.
Grammar Alternative: Daman.____ has been chosen for the debate competition, is a clever boy.
Grammar Alternative: The Chief guest said that it ____ him great pleasure to be there that evening.
Error Detection: He has been seen loiter in the corridor.
Error Detection: We have lose a leader and able Statesman.
Error Detection: They are committed big mistakes.
Error Detection: He tied the horse by a rope.
Error Detection: The teacher was pleased at me.
Sentence Improvement: You must accustom yourself with new ideas.
Sentence Improvement: Try to lower the amount of fat in your diet.
questions.answer: B (Reduce is better than lower for quantities/amounts)

questions.question: Sentence Improvement: No sooner than it stopped raining, the children went out.
options: c) did it stop raining than
d) had it stopped raining than
questions.answer: C (Should be 'No sooner did it stop raining than...')

questions.question: Sentence Improvement: You should cut off on the amount of cigarettes you smoke.
Sentence Improvement: I contradicted against him

questions.question: Correct Sentence:
options: (A) Fact is often stranger than fiction

questions.question: Correct Sentence: (i) They were impressed by his performance. (ii) They were impressed with his performance. (iii) They were impressed over his performance.
Correct Sentence: (i) The purse is lying on the table. (ii) The purse is lying at the table. (iii) The purse is lying in the table.
questions.answer: D (i is common, ii/iii are contextual, but i is grammatically preferred)

questions.question: Correct Sentence: (i) The man whom I marry must be able to make a decent omelette. (ii) The man that I marry must be able to make a decent omelette. (iii) The man who I marry must be able to make a decent omelette.
Correct Sentence: (i) They travelled toward the jungle. (ii) They travelled into the jungle. (iii) They travelled across the jungle.
Correct Sentence: (i) I own that book. (ii) That book belongs to me. (iii) That book is mine.
Correct Sentence: (i) Everyone in the house heard me singing in the shower. (ii) Everyone in the house heard mine singing in the shower. (iii) Everyone in the house heard my singing in the shower.
questions.answer: B (i is correct with the objective pronoun; iii is correct with the possessive adjective)

questions.question: Correct Sentence: (i) Every student was told to go to their advisor. (ii) Every student was told to go to his or her advisor. (iii) The students were told to go to their advisors.
Correct Sentence: (i) When he lost my book I became very angry. (ii) When he lost my book I got very angry. (iii) When he lost my book I felt very angry.
Correct Sentence: (i) The book will be launched next week. (ii) In the following week, they launched the book. (iii) In the next week, they launched the book.
Correct Sentence: (i) The daughter praised only her brother. (ii) The daughter only praised her brother. (iii) The daughter praised her only brother.

questions.question: (A) Reading in / (B) the passage carefully / (C) is important / (D) No error

I. The parents told the Principal that it was not their intention to interfere in the running of the school. II. The parents said they did not intend to interfere with the running of the school. III. The parents said they had no intention of interfering with the running of the school.
I. Although Ben is poor, he is not dishonest. II. Poor as Ben is, he is not dishonest. III. Ben is poor and not dishonest.
I. We never imagined that she would win the prize. II. We had never ever imagined that she would win the prize. III. Little did we imagine that she would win the prize.
I. It was thought that Mike might have stolen the money. II. Mike was suspected to stealing the money. III. Suspicion fell on Mike for stealing the money.

I. According to the newspaper, the athletes from Third World Countries were felicitated at the Olympic Games. II. The newspaper reported that athletes from Third World Countries were felicitated at the Olympic Games. III. It was reported in the newspaper that athletes from Third World Countries were felicitated at the Olympic Games.

I. His amateur attempt to disguise failed and the police arrested the overconfident trickster. II. His amateur attempt at disguise failed and the police arrested the overconfident trickster. III. His amateur attempt at disguising failed and the police arrested the overconfident trickster.

I. He firmly believes that the Stonehenge was built by aliens. II. It is his firm conviction that the Stonehenge was built by aliens. III. He is firmly convinced that the Stonehenge was built by aliens.
I. It is not my concern what he does with his money. II. What he does with his money is none of my concern. III. What he does with his money is no concern of mine.
I. He said he was sorry to leave the country. II. He expressed his regret at leaving the country. III. He said he was sorry at leaving the country.

I. Rather than arrive at a hasty decision we should talk it out. II. Rather than arrive at a hasty decision we should talk it over. III. Rather than arrive at a hasty decision we should talk about it.
I. He had leave of four days. II. The harassed wife shot herself with a gun after bidding her husband the last goodbye. III. With a frown on his face, the teacher asked the student to leave the room.
I. It was so big a box that I could not lift it. II. He got an employment there. III. Mankind should love nature.
I. Many villagers cannot write his name. II. People often spend their leisure in cinemas. III. John said can he go home.
I. He takes no care over his work. II. I went to the bank yesterday to collect the passbook. III. John said can he go home.
I. I would not hear you. II. Nobody will want to play in his team if he does not treat people kindly. III. It is far too hard an essay for me to attempt.
I. Many works must close owing to lack of fuel, if the strike lasts till weekend. II. I was second in my class. III. Travelling from Karjat to Khandala, one would find the line most beautifully laid.
I. As the train which is my usual was missing I had to travel on the next. II. I don't know whether he will come or not. III. I missed the train which I usually catch and had to travel by the next.
I. He carried little Bhim and I on his shoulders. II. All that he said had no effect on me. III. Those who did this should be punished.
I. Everyone of the boys loves to ride. II. Much pains has been taken. III. One should not waste one's time.
I. Our followers are but a handful. II. Neither he nor I was there. III. Many a glorious deeds were done.

options: (A) David said he was directing a new flim.

options: (A) He says that he went home on Friday.

options: (B) He ask me to sit down.

questions.question: The white chairs in the sitting room is made of teak.
He was asking my opinion for the film.
He has the guts to rise from the occasion.
I had not completed my project so I thought I was (done with) when the Manager asked me. (File 16 - Improvement)
Robin was upset and so (picked up) his food... (File 16 - Improvement)
Serious charges of corruption were (levied against) him. (File 16 - Improvement)
I shall favor (its') adoption. (File 16 - Improvement)
I prefer remaining silent (to) speaking falsehood. (File 16 - Improvement)
questions.answer: D (Prefer X to Y is correct).

questions.question: Choose correct sentences (1): (i) There was an error of judgement. (ii) There were an error... (iii) There was no error...
Choose correct sentences (2): (i) We pining... (ii) We have not been pining... (iii) We have been pining...
Choose correct sentences (3): (i) He finished the work in ten days. (ii) She will do the work within twelve days. (iii) We will do the work since five days. (Incorrect use of since)
Choose correct sentences (4): (i) The school is above the river. (ii) The school is beyond the river. (iii) The school stands between the valleys.
questions.answer: D (All are grammatically possible, though (iii) is slightly odd "between the valleys" usually implies two, but acceptable).

questions.question: Choose correct sentences (5): (i) The Director... has made this announcement. (ii) The Chief Justice... has written... (iii) Justice Umesh Bhatt attend... (Incorrect, should be attends/attended)
Choose correct sentences (6): (i) She called on me... (ii) Someone has been enquiring for you... (iii) She enquire... (Incorrect, should be enquired/enquires)
Choose correct sentences (7): (i) The police acquainted us... (ii) They acquitted themselves from honour. (Strange usage) (iii) The magistrate acquitted him of all charges.
Choose correct sentences (8): (i) I was disgusted at him at his rudeness. (Clunky) (ii) I was disgusted by his rudeness. (iii) We are disgusted at her rude behaviour.
questions.answer: C (or B, "disgusted at" is valid, (i) has double 'at').

questions.question: Choose correct sentences (9): (i) She confided in her friend. (ii) He could confide in his friend. (iii) We confided our fears to our parents.
Choose correct sentences (10): (i) She looked pleased with herself. (ii) She looked unpleased... (Unpleased is rare, displeased is standard) (iii) The teacher was greatly pleased at...
He suggests that we should be bound by a code of conduct, isn't it?
In order to write poetry, one has to be both sensitive and creative.
Bees produce sweet honey as its sting is deadly.
I am tired as I am working since 7 o'clock...
Sheela told her teacher to explain the chapter once again.

b) The center of the village is the school in.
c) The school the center of the village is in.
d) The village is in the center of the school.

questions.question: Sentence Structure:
options: a) Every week to the hostels the vegetables are delivered.
b) The vegetables are delivered every week to the hostels.
c) To the hostels every week the vegetables are delivered.
d) The vegetables to the hostels are delivered every week.

questions.question: Sentence Structure:
options: a) Next week's figures an improvement to show are expected.
b) An improvement to show are expected next week's figures.
c) Next week's figures are expected to show an improvement.
d) An improvement next week's figures are expected to show.

questions.question: Sentence Structure:
options: a) It's your documents a copy to keep it's a good idea.
b) It's a good idea to keep a copy of your documents.
c) To keep a copy of your documents it's a good idea.
d) It's good idea a copy of your document to keep.

questions.question: Sentence Structure:
options: a) Without being played the match the players left.
b) The players the match without being played left.
c) The match without being played the players left.
d) The players left without the match being played.

questions.question: The white chairs in the sitting room is made of teak.
He was asking my opinion for the film.
He has the guts to rise from the occasion.
Robert wished he was rich enough to travel the world.
questions.answer: D (or "were" for subjunctive, but "was" is accepted in colloquial. However, "to be" (C) changes meaning. No improvement/Error is often D. Strict grammar might prefer "were". If D is No Error, it's likely D).

questions.question: People are wanting to see the home team win.
questions.answer: A (Stative verbs like "want" usually don't take continuous form. "People want").

questions.question: He suggested that we should be bound by a code of conduct, isn't it?
Bees produce sweet honey as its sting is deadly.
questions.answer: A (Contrast: honey is sweet but sting is deadly).

questions.question: I am tired as I am working since 7 o'clock...
Sheela told her teacher to explain the chapter once again.
I have wrote a letter to her.
She has been plucks flowers since morning.
Charlie Tan sentences:
questions.answer: A (Wait. Option A in File 42 Q4 is "Charlie Tan, whose wife lived in China, died...". B is "...died quite some times ago". C is "who's wife". D is "who's wife". Option A is correct grammar "whose" and "time ago").  A.

questions.question: India has achieves a commendable progress... (File 47 - Improvement)
options: c) got an achievement which is commendable
d) gotten a great commendable achievement

questions.question: Adult education means education of aged persons who is illiterate. (File 47 - Improvement)
questions.answer: A (Persons are plural, so "who are illiterate").

questions.question: Human intervention produces changes... and as a result it becomes imbalanced. (File 47 - Improvement)
options: c) thus it created an imbalance

questions.question: Land pollution can control by judicious and proper use... (File 47 - Improvement)
questions.answer: C (Passive voice required: should be controlled).

questions.question: The disposal of radioactive waste is fraught with risk. (File 47 - Improvement)
options: a) is fraught with a lot of risk
b) was a lot of risk

questions.question: Computers are easy to learn and it is called a student friendly machine. (File 47 - Improvement)
options: b) are very easy to learn
questions.answer: D (Correct usage, even if slightly non-parallel - it refers to "computer" singular concept).

questions.question: This device allows you to talk to people almost any place in the world. (File 47 - Improvement)
questions.answer: C (Any place should be anywhere/almost all places).

questions.question: I was delighted to see him fully recover. (File 6 - Improvement)
questions.answer: A (or D depending on strict grammar, but "fully recovered" acts as adjective phrase. However, "see him fully recover" (infinitive) is also valid. Option A "him fully recovered" emphasizes the state).

questions.question: They didn't pay any heed to their superior's instructions; I did neither. (File 6 - Improvement)
The fast train came a halt to before crossing the bridge. (File 6 - Improvement)
options: a) came before to a halt
b) came to a halt to
c) came to a halt before

questions.question: I can always count on him in times of difficulty. (File 6 - Improvement)
It was so dark that the children were terribly frightened. (File 6 - Improvement)
He took a longer time to read the text for he wanted to go about it carefully. (File 6 - Improvement)
Your suggestion is no different from the other employees. (File 6 - Improvement)
options: c) not different from that of the
questions.answer: C (Comparison must be between suggestions, not suggestion and employees).

questions.question: Though his actions were severe criticised, he didn't lose his temper. (File 6 - Improvement)
He was untiring in his efforts to eliminate unnecessary controls. (File 6 - Improvement)
The purchase made by him brought with him a number of prizes. (File 6 - Improvement)
Choose the correct sentences (1): i. He is too weak to walk. ii. He is walking too weakly. iii. He is so weak that he cannot walk.
questions.answer: B (i and iii are standard transformations).

questions.question: Choose the correct sentences (2): i. The news is so good that it are true. (Incorrect verb) ii. The news is too good to be true. iii. The news is so good that it cannot be true.
Choose the correct sentences (3): i. Only students are allowed here. ii. You are allowed here only if you are a student. iii. Allowed are only students here.

Choose the correct sentences (4): i. Tell me the time and place of your birth. ii. I would like to know the time and place of your birth. iii. Could you kindly tell me the time and place of your birth?
Choose the correct sentences (5): i. You may go anywhere. ii. Nowhere you may go. iii. You may go wherever you like.
Choose the correct sentences (6): i. He eats too much for his own good. ii. He eats too much. iii. He eats more than what is enough.
Choose the correct sentences (7): i. Studying always made him sleepy. ii. He is feeling like studying wherever he is sleeping. iii. He always feels sleepy when he is studying.
Choose the correct sentences (8): i. This statue is of no use. ii. What is the use of this statue? iii. There is no use of this statue.
questions.answer: A (iii is typically "There is no use for this statue" or "It is of no use").

questions.question: Choose the correct sentences (9): i. I could not attend the meeting on account of my illness. ii. I could not attend the meeting as I was ill. iii. I could not be ill to attend the meeting.
Choose the correct sentences (10): i. He is an orator of great repute. ii. He is orator and greatly repute. iii. He is an extremely renowned orator.

questions.question: IT'S OKAY / TO DISAGREE / BUT ONE SHOULD DO IT RESPECTIVELY. (Error is in part C)

CHARLES DICKENS / IS / A GREAT WRITER DURING HIS TIME. (Error is in part B)
options: c) A GREAT WRITER DURING HIS TIME.

options: b) IS NOT TO BE FOUND IN WEALTH

questions.question: "Twenty miles are a long distance to walk" remarked Mary (Sentence Improvement)
He highlighted the contribution of women for bringing about social and economic changes. (Sentence Improvement)

She has not spoken to her mother since they quarreled. (Sentence Improvement)

After the summer break, school will open after two weeks.
The stream flowed gently under the bridge.
The train from Chennai arrived right in schedule.
The speeding driver is finally caught over the police.
The children enjoyed rowing the boat on the lake.
Aaron found it very difficult to part of his wife

Mina's book was translate to many different languages

Hardly had I reached the station when the train started.
He is wilful to help you.
His father died when he was very young.
questions.answer: B (Polite improvement, though died is correct. 'Passed away' is standard euphemism). Actually 'died' is not grammatically wrong. But 'passed away' is often preferred in tests as 'improvement'. If no error is not an option that fits best, B is likely. Wait, D is No improvement. 'Died' is factual. 'Passed away' is improvement in tone. Let's check if 'died' has error. No. But questions often ask for 'better'. I will mark B.
